events.message: The customer reported a car accident that happened on April 30th causing significant damage to the vehicle's front bumper and hood.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after verifying the details of the collision involving the insured vehicle.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the case and to communicate with the customer for next steps.
The claim acknowledgment was sent to the customer informing them that the process has commenced smoothly.
Documents requested included the police report, photos of the damage, and the repair estimates from the garage.
Customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including detailed photos and official accident reports.
The investigation team initiated the review of submitted documents and contacted witnesses to verify accident details.
Investigation completed successfully confirming the claimant’s version of events and verifying the extent of damage.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering the repair costs and associated expenses.
The customer was satisfied with the proposed settlement and expressed appreciation for the timely support.
Claim was officially approved by the claims department confirming the compensation agreement.
Payment for the approved claim was issued successfully to the customer’s bank account.
The claim was closed after full settlement and confirmation that all procedures were completed satisfactorily.
All case files and documentation were archived securely for future reference and compliance records.
